intro: Peristrophe guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically Guangxi Province. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, though it is not a true palm. The plant is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically arranged in panicles, followed by berry-like fruits. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
